JobStatus.IN_PROGRESS should be replaced by custom enum which will then be mapped to JobStatus.IN_PROGRESS in the deploymentStatusKeeper when deployment type is IOT_JOBS. For other types it must map to other expected statuses. Same applies to FAILED and SUCCEED status updates
Agreed, but it would be better to make this change when there is another deployment method that required status updates sent via another channel.

If the connectToAWSIot get a device configuration exception because device was not configured to communicate with Iot cloud then this step should not happen. We can argue that it does not hurt, but it is not clean.
In that case the device should not receive any deployments of type IOT_JOB. In that case this call back will not be invoked.

How does this thread continue to live? If the thread dies then the subscription/communication with Iot cloud will also die right? Have you tested this E2E?

The connectToAWSIot will not run once the mqtt connection is established.  Once a connection is established, onConnectionResumed call back is used to re-subscribe to topics used by iot jobs. Yes we do not attempt to create a new mqtt connection after one has been established, i think this behavior is ok for now as the reconnect will be handled by mqtt proxy in the future.
